alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued September 16 at 7:05AM AKDT until September 17 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...South winds 45 to 65 mph with gusts of 75 to 85 mph expected. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta. * WHEN...From 4 PM Today to 10 AM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose objects, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel will be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A powerful storm is reaching peak intensity this morning over the Western Bering and will begin to track northeast towards St. Lawrence Island through Saturday morning. The systems front will reach the coastline this afternoon, but winds will steadily increase through the day today. The strongest winds will be along the coast to the west of the Kuskokwim Delta and over Nunivak Island, where gusts between 75 and 85 mph will be likely. Farther inland, sustained winds are expected to be around 45 mph with gusts to 70 mph possible.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
